indication: Unstable angina with abnormal ECG findings
findings: 70% stenosis in the left anterior descending (LAD) artery.

procedure_name: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) with Drug-Eluting Stent Placement
findings: Successful stent deployment with restored TIMI grade 3 flow.
outcome: Improved coronary blood flow. Patient stable post-procedure.

indication: Evaluation of chest pain and cardiac function
findings: Mild left ventricular hypertrophy. Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) approximately 50%. No significant valvular abnormalities.
outcome: Medical management continued. No urgent intervention required.
notes: Recommend repeat echo in 6-12 months for monitoring.
